server

Class CameraControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.CameraControl

  • public class CameraControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Petter, Anton, Dragan & Sven on 2016-11-14.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CameraControl()
      Creates a shared resource for a server based camera.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Clears the data package.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CameraControl

        public CameraControl()
        Creates a shared resource for a server based camera. Stores images and server related attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • putImage

        public void putImage(byte[] jpg,
                     byte[] timeStamp,
                     boolean motionDet)
        Stores an image in the shared resource CameraControl. The shared resource enters movie mode if motion was detected
        Parameters:
        jpg - An image in JPG format, contained in a byte array.
        timeStamp - A timestamp for when the image was taken, contained in a byte array.
        motionDet - A boolean that tells if a camera detected motion.

      • grabByteFrame

        public byte[] grabByteFrame()
        Getter method for a data package to be sent over a network connection.
        Returns:
        The next data package to be sent.

      • clearByteArray

        public void clearByteArray()
        Clears the data package. For proper use, call this method after sending the message to avoid duplicates.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(byte[] mode)
        Sets the mode depending on the byte. Possible modes are movie mode or idle mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - The mode that will be set. Decimal 2 = movie mode, decimal 4 = idle mode.

      • putInputStream

        public void putInputStream(java.io.InputStream is)
        Store the servers input stream in the shared resource
        Parameters:
        is - The input stream that the input shread is going to use

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Getter for the servers input stream. Should be used to be able to read messages sent to the server.
        Returns:
        The input stream for the server.

      • resetInputStream

        public void resetInputStream()
        Sets the input stream to null. Should be used to insure proper usage after connection timeout
